issue.title: updated go-openapi dependencies
issue.body:
Update is broken (go-openapi/analysis broken after breaking change in go-openapi/spec@v0.19.9)

This PR integrates the fix (dry run with analysis replaced on wip branch)

The CI remains broken on windows (see https://github.com/go-swagger/go-swagger/issues/2428). I am working on that one this week.

Signed-off-by: Frederic BIDON <fredbi@yahoo.com>

body:
Yes this is an unexpected consequence of fixing another bug...
I believe that the proper fix should be with  a custom json marshalling in go-openapi/spec: the problem here is to display "description" when there is a "$ref".

issue.title: Omit to marshal response description as JSON when $ref is defined
issue.body:
Modifying the "omitempty" tag in response.Description and SecurityScheme.AuthorizationURL (originally intended to fix go-swagger/go-swagger#1775) had unintended consequences like:
- invalid marshalled json when the response is a $ref
- invalid marshall json security scheme when the type is not oauth2

* contributes go-swagger/go-swagger#2429
* contributes go-swagger/go-swagger#2430

Signed-off-by: Frederic BIDON <fredbi@yahoo.com>

body:
@eimlav just attempted a quick fix https://github.com/go-openapi/spec/pull/127
Now I need some more time to test the other go-openapi repos. But you may give it a shot.

@fredbi I checked out go-swagger master, pinned your branch https://github.com/fredbi/spec/tree/fix-2429 and rebuilt the go-swagger binary. It is now omitting the empty descriptions and passing validation.
@eimlav thanks. This helps me a lot.

issue.title: Sync'ed up expectations in tests with updated go-openapi/spec
Updated go-openapi
issue.body:
* fixes #2429
* fixes #2430
* fixes #1775

Signed-off-by: Frederic BIDON <fredbi@yahoo.com>

body: @fredbi I completely missed this as I changed it when testing out your fix, but you need to remove the replace directive in go.mod too https://github.com/go-swagger/go-swagger/blob/master/go.mod#L3 or else the updated version of go-openapi/spec is never used.
@eimlav  ah crap I forgot to remove it. Thanks for letting me know. I am going to fix this up ASAP
